Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Report empty v-model attributes with nice debug message" (#7620) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve? If accidentally creating markup with empty v-model attribute a strange debug message is displayed. The vue element renders empty. Error can be seen with the following hello world empty v-model attribute. Yes this is a user error but may save someone a lot of time if better message is displayed ```

{{ message }}

new Vue({ el: '#app', data: { message: 'Hello Vue.js!' } }) ``` ### What does the proposed API look like? Provide better error message vs below when the v-model attribute is empty ``` [Vue warn]: Failed to generate render function: SyntaxError: Unexpected token , in with(this){return Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Type declaration incomplete for Location.query" (#1932) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/82013/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/82013/) (This doesn't actually work, but shows the code you'd need locally to repro the bug)

### Steps to reproduce
0. Note that JSFiddle doesn't appear to give Typescript compiler errors, so the repro linked will have to be ported into a local Typescript Vue project.

1. In a Typescript Vue project:
```
router.push({ query: { array: ["1", "2", "3"] }})
```

### What is expected?
This should compile without error 

### What is actually happening?
You get an error:
```
 error TS2345: Argument of type '{ name: string; query: QueryParams; }' is not assignable to parameter of type 'RawLocation'.
  Type '{ name: string; query: QueryParams; }' is not assignable to type 'Location'.
    Types of property 'query' are incompatible.
      Type 'QueryParams' is not assignable to type 'Dictionary<string> | undefined'.
        Type 'QueryParams' is not assignable to type 'Dictionary<string>'.
          Index signatures are incompatible.
            Type 'string | string[] | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'.
              Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'.
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Typescript error accessing this.$router.options" (#2051) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/peterssonanton/vue-example](https://github.com/peterssonanton/vue-example)

### Steps to reproduce
npm run build

Gives this error:
 ERROR  Failed to compile with 2 errors                                                                                              08:25:37

 error  in /Users/antonpetersson/my-project/src/views/Home.vue

(25,30): Property 'options' does not exist on type 'VueRouter'.

 error  in /Users/antonpetersson/my-project/src/views/Home.vue

(26,25): Property 'options' does not exist on type 'VueRouter'.

### What is expected?
The options property exists on VueRouter, if running 'npm run serve' the app starts (with typescript errors still) and is working.

### What is actually happening?
Typescript is giving a compilation error

---
The example repo is created with the vue-cli: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-cli with only a few lines added code in Home.vue to reproduce the error

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Query/Location can be an array of strings. (fix #1932)" (#2050) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

Query and Location can be arrays as can be deduced from a spec [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/test/unit/specs/query.spec.js#L6-L8) and [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/test/unit/specs/query.spec.js#L19-L20).

I guess for custom parsing user needs to provide own types and override ones coming from router somehow.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Shopping cart example update" (#1137) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
- remove mutation type
- rename `addToCart` action to `addProductToCart`
- rename products module’s `addToCart` mutation to `decrementProductInventory`
- rename cart module’s `addToCart` mutation to `pushProductToCart`
- make mutations responsible for updating one piece of the state


Now instead of having two mutations of the same type, the `addProductToCart` action commits `pushProductToCart` and `decrementProductInventory`.

cc @ktsn https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1109

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""Do not mutate store state outside mutation handler" error but I am using a mutation" (#1151) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
Version

3.0.1

Reproduction link

https://github.com/davewood/vuejs-demo/tree/vuex_mutation_error

Steps to reproduce

git clone -b vuex_mutation_error git@github.com:davewood/vuejs-demo.git
cd vuejs-demo
npm install
npm run dev
trigger error in console by changing the language in top right corner

What is expected?

the state is changed and a notification is shown as expected but i dont get an error in the console

details:

  • store has an array of notifications
  • notifications are added using a mutation in src/store.js
  • global Vue handler to trigger notification is installed in src/notify.js

What is actually happening?

the code works but there is an error in the console 

[Vue warn]: Error in callback for watcher "function () { return this._data.$$state }": "Error: [vuex] Do not mutate vuex store state outside mutation handlers."

(found in <Root>)  9:579:7
    warn webpack-internal:///9:579:7
    logError webpack-internal:///9:1714:5
    globalHandleError webpack-internal:///9:1709:3
    handleError webpack-internal:///9:1698:3
    run webpack-internal:///9:3209:11
    update webpack-internal:///9:3181:5
    notify webpack-internal:///9:685:5
    mutator webpack-internal:///9:843:5
    add_notification/< webpack-internal:///116:21:9
Error: [vuex] Do not mutate vuex store state outside mutation handlers.
Stack trace:
assert@webpack-internal:///50:104:27
enableStrictMode/<@webpack-internal:///50:753:7
run@webpack-internal:///9:3207:11
update@webpack-internal:///9:3181:5
notify@webpack-internal:///9:685:5
mutator@webpack-internal:///9:843:5
add_notification/<@webpack-internal:///116:21:9
  9:1718:5
    logError webpack-internal:///9:1718:5
    globalHandleError webpack-internal:///9:1709:3
    handleError webpack-internal:///9:1698:3
    run webpack-internal:///9:3209:11
    update webpack-internal:///9:3181:5
    notify webpack-internal:///9:685:5
    mutator webpack-internal:///9:843:5
    add_notification/< webpack-internal:///116:21:9
